Tornado watch issued for eastern Mass.until 9 p.m.

The watch was issued by the National Weather Service as strong thunderstorms and heavy downpours arrive from western and central Massachusetts. (Globe, 3:52 p.m.)

Globe movie critic Ty Burr says “The Campaign” is "just another happily idiotic Will Ferrell comedy" with a "fair amount of indecent laughs to be had."

Suffolk Downs applies for casino license

The track announced today that it has submitted its non-refundable $400,000 application fee and formally applied for a casino license. (Boston Globe, 11:48 a.m.)
  • More coverage of casino gambling in Massachusetts
  • Proposed casino sites | Suffolk Downs pictures | Discuss

Police: Woman raped in Harvard Yard

The woman was pulled behind Massachusetts Hall and attacked after entering Harvard Yard at about 3:05 a.m. today, university police said. (Globe, 2:23 p.m.)

Police: Malden man confessed to murder

William Moseley (left) allegedly told a dispatcher: "I killed her. She's dead." His girlfriend, Cecilia Yakubu, was found dead, police said. (Globe, 1:35 p.m.)

Human-biting EEE-infected mosquitoes found in Reading, spraying scheduled

The EEE-infected mosquitoes found in Reading are the first to be detected this season outside of Cape Cod and Southeastern Massachusetts. (Boston Globe, 1:18 p.m.)
